DataElement.preferredName: Hematology Fasting Serum Insulin Laboratory Procedure Result  Value  in mU/L
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Abstaining from food._The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._Human insulin protein (110 aa, 12 kDa) is encoded by the human insulin (INS) gene. This cytosolic protein, a heterodimer of disulfide-linked alpha and beta chains, is produced in pancreatic islet beta cells. Binding of insulin to its receptor stimulates glucose uptake, accelerates both glycolysis and the pentose phosphate cycle and increases glycogen synthesis in the liver. Insulin regulates protein and lipid metabolism. It also decreases blood glucose concentration by shuttling molecules into cells to be used for energy. Decreased expression of insulin protein causes familial hyperproinsulinemia._A laboratory result measured in a quantity equivalent to the one thousandth unit (10E-3 unit) per liter. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematology Procedure Fasting Serum Insulin Laboratory
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Abstaining from food._The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._Human insulin protein (110 aa, 12 kDa) is encoded by the human insulin (INS) gene. This cytosolic protein, a heterodimer of disulfide-linked alpha and beta chains, is produced in pancreatic islet beta cells. Binding of insulin to its receptor stimulates glucose uptake, accelerates both glycolysis and the pentose phosphate cycle and increases glycogen synthesis in the liver. Insulin regulates protein and lipid metabolism. It also decreases blood glucose concentration by shuttling molecules into cells to be used for energy. Decreased expression of insulin protein causes familial hyperproinsulinemia.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredDefinition: Abstaining from food.:The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:(IN-su-lin) A hormone made by the islet cells of the pancreas. Insulin controls the amount of sugar in the blood by moving it into the cells, where it can be used by the body for energy.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
Insulin (51 aa, ~6 kDa) is encoded by the human INS gene. This protein is involved in the direct regulation of glucose metabolism.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
